case_data.name: CRIPA Investigation, Powhatan (VA)
case_data.summary:
On May 7, 1996, the Civil Rights Division of the U.S. Department of Justice [DOJ] notified the state of Virginia that it intended to investigate the conditions of confinement at the Beaumont Juvenile Correctional Center pursuant to the Civil Rights of Institutionalized Persons Act (CRIPA), 42 U.S.C. § 1997 et seq.

The investigation was to focus on allegations regarding physical and mental abuse of juveniles by staff, the improper use of isolation and segregation, an unacceptably high risk of violence in the correctional center, and inadequate medical and mental health care.

We have no further information regarding the investigation.

documents.text:
U.S. Department of Justice
Civil Rights Division
Office of the Assistant Attorney General  Washington, D.C 20035
May 7, 1996
The Honorable George Allen
Governor, Commonwealth of Virginia
State Capitol
Richmond, VA  23219
Re:  CRIPA Investigation of Beaumont Juvenile Correctional
Center
Dear Governor Allen:
I am writing to inform you that the United States Department
of Justice intends to investigate conditions at the Beaumont
Juvenile Correctional Center pursuant to the Civil Rights of
Institutionalized Persons Act  (CRIPA), 42 U.S.C. § 1997 e_t seq.
The purpose of the investigation will be to determine
whether conditions at the correctional center violate the
constitutional rights of juvenile inmates.  The investigation
will focus on, but may not be limited to, allegations we have
received regarding physical and mental abuse of juveniles by
staff, the improper use of isolation and segregation, an
unacceptably high risk of violence in the correctional center,
and inadequate medical and mental health care!
The initiation of this investigation does not evidence any
prejudgment on our part that constitutional rights have been
violated.  Additionally, if any violations are found, we intend
to confer with you and your staff concerning any appropriate
corrective action.
We would like to initiate this investigation as soon as
possible.  Attorneys from my office will contact your staff
within the next week to arrange for a production of documents
relevant to the issues described above, and a subsequent
inspection of the correctional center by attorneys from, and
expert consultants retained by, the Civil Rights Division.  The
attorney responsible for this matter is Christy Lopez of the
Special Litigation Section of the Civil Rights Division, who can
be reached at  (202) 616-3197.
